website_summaries.verdict: An excellent chain from a stellar company. Chain tightness is auto-adjusted and grip is assured.
pros: An extremely stable product that suits everything from smaller cars to minivans
cons: Manufacturer recommends a speed limit of 30 mph

customer_reviews.title: Rusted after first use
customer_reviews.text: I've owned quite a few styles of chains. Given the limited space for a chain on my Car I went with this pair. Looked great for a day, the began to oxidize And became potentially dangerous to drive with. Emailed the seller, no help there. Very disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Expert

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: Three reasons: 1) it FELL OFF. I triple checked the tire size and ensured the chain was installed correctly. I pull over because i was drifting a little, and had to walk a mile back in the snow in oncoming traffic to retrieve it. 2) it wrecked my car’s wheel well. Going over 25 mph, the chain makes an awful noise and shredded what was my wheel well. My car has relatively small space here, so I’m not too angry about this, but still shows bad design. 3) it BROKE. on my way back home (going 25 mph with hazards on), one of the chain links snapped and rendered the entire chain useless and unfixable. (i’ll add a photo later)
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Don't Trust Amazon Sizing For These Chains!
customer_reviews.text: I've got a 2011 Subaru Outback. The tire size is P225/60R17 and the Amazon guide said the SZ139 Super Z6 was the right fit. Unfortunately it does not fit. The cables seem well built and are relatively easy to put on the car but they are too small by a long shot. Visually inspecting the cables while trying to put them on, it looks like the right size would fit the car an have enough clearance to safely drive it. If you buy these chains, look somewhere other than the Amazon sizing recommendations if you want to make sure you get chains that will actually fit your car.
customer_reviews.author: Adam F. Jewell

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $$$$
customer_reviews.text: These were recommended by Honda as the only chains that will fit our van, as there is very minimal clearance around the tires on the Odyssey. They were easy to put on but a little difficult to get off due to the limited clearance. I can see how any other chain would have been impossible to use. I do love the tensioner device much more that traditional chains and if I need chains in the future for another vehicle I will be purchasing these again. As far a drivability, these passed the test. Safely drove from Washington to California in record snow/ice storms without issue.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy B.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy, no traction
customer_reviews.text: Fast easy installation with no need to move the vehicle. Designed-in rubber tightener means there is no need to stop and retighten after installation. But no traction because the cylinders turn around the wires and against the tires. And touches the shock absorbers.
customer_reviews.author: Rodolphe

customer_reviews.title: Not as easy to install as they say
customer_reviews.text: The video made them seem easy to install but actually it requires a LOT more elbow grease than portrayed. The inside fastener has to be stretched and attached blindly. The hook-and-eye on my set don't attach easily, I think they may be defective. It's almost impossible to get them attached properly. The black and yellow tightener requires a lot of strength to attach, which makes sense because they do have to be tight, but they aren't easy to put on. Aside from that, once you get them on they seem to work very well.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cross reference charts don't match!!!
customer_reviews.text: Be careful which cross reference chart you use to select the cable size for your vehicle. I ordered the 429 size based on the cross-reference chart that Amazon direct me to. Cables did not fit! Another cross reference chart told me to get the 435 size, which actually fit. So order early and give yourself time to test fit BEFORE you REALLY need them. Also note that the 6mm cable width refers to the INNER cable width. the "springs" that wrap around the cables are actually about 12mm+. It might be a VERY tight fit on your car. Order spare tensioners, and you might want to keep an old pair of gloves with the chains.
customer_reviews.author: J. Windle

customer_reviews.title: Fits My Car Tires
customer_reviews.text: I live in the PNW, where it rarely snows in the city, mostly on the mountains. We're required to carry chains even if we don't need to use them, which is just good advice. I bought these before my long road trip which took me through Siskiyou Pass during their 1st snow. Did a test run for putting on & taking off, but never drove with them on. I'm hoping I'll never have to use it, but winters are always different in these parts.
customer_reviews.author: LilyPut

customer_reviews.title: recommend
customer_reviews.text: We used these on our Subaru Outback during blizzard conditions in Mammoth. We weren't sure that we needed chains but all the roads were saying chains required. We were happy to have them and could handle massive snow with these. We got 5 ft that weekend and were good to go. Got a little noisy on the highway ride home but stopped and checked them and were totally fine. We kept to about 30 mph although couldn't find a lot of info about speed limit with them. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Gieszl

customer_reviews.title: The best cables bar none!
customer_reviews.text: The Z-Chains have been my prefered snow chains for many years now. I always buy them when I either change cars or tire size. With the three point connection it is as easy as can be to install them without diving the car onto them. The rubber tensioners mean no driving a few mile and then stopping to readjust for looseness. I will say that my tires having less than a thousand miles made them a bit tight at first. This is actually good because it means as the tires wear from normal use (ie: get smaller) the chains will never be too big. The Z-design works very well with ABS brakes.
customer_reviews.author: Michael G.

customer_reviews.title: Held up well
customer_reviews.text: We used these at Big Bear in Southern California this year. They held up really well, got us through the icy/snowy roads and when we got into town and were on the pavement, they didn't break. The first time putting them on can take a while to figure out, so I'd suggest taking a look at them and the instructions prior to getting up there for the first time with them. A little tough to get on, but once they're on, they're secure. Easy to get off.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: They installed and uninstalled very nice and very quick
customer_reviews.text: They installed and uninstalled very nice and very quick. We haven;t yet driven on them on snow or ice (not winter yet), but they live up to their hype about easy install and take down for sure. My daughter installed and took down by herself and as a dad that makes me real happy! Nice little storage case too, they fit right back in. Also, they fit the tire size and small SUV application we purchased them for. Very happy with that too. I hope they hold up when actually driving on them, but I have no real doubts about them.
customer_reviews.author: J.E.

customer_reviews.title: Easy, effective but will rust and links will fall off
customer_reviews.text: The picture attached is after a single use Pros #Fit : 5\5 #Effective in snow : 5\5 #Ease of putting them on and on getting them off 4\5 Tip: carry an old coat hanger with you so you can pull the chains around the well when putting it on Tip : when removing it do one wheel at a time and move the car forward /backward so you can detach there back harness easily Cons #The chain is so rusted After a single use # some of the meta circular links haven't fallen off I think it's only get worst with each use
customer_reviews.author: sfuse

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I always heard that chains were a royal pain to install and remove. This was my first experience with them and these were remarkable straightforward to install, and not that hard to remove, even for the first time! I did not have to drive too far with them on but they held well and gave me additional traction. Then again, they are not cleats and I eventually had to leave the car at the bottom of the driveway and walk the final distance. With little to compare them against, I would have to give them an A plus!
customer_reviews.author: Sunnyvale Shadow

customer_reviews.title: easiest chains I have ever installed.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a trip to Tahoe with our Sequoia. Dry fitted before heading out, got stuck in a snowstorm and had to put them on. Took all of 5 minutes to install, my 14 year old daughter installed one side while I did the other. They do make quite a racket above 20 miles an hour. No problems with traction but did find out that there was an issue with the traction control sensor(s) on the Sequoia (I don't like traction control, grew up without it an feel like it is constantly fighting me). Disabled the TCS and all was good.
customer_reviews.author: G. Lowe

customer_reviews.title: tricky to install in bad weather, poor durability
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install in my driveway, much harder with driving snow, wind and standing water. The old style cables that you drove onto are easier to install in those conditions. I drove on these for about 140 miles at 20-25mph, comfort was as expected (meh...) but I had to twice cut away a link that snapped off on one side and was threatening to damage the wheel well by flailing around. Not sure if I need to buy these again (devil you know....) or get different ones for my next winter trip.
customer_reviews.author: sconcin

customer_reviews.title: Not bad - could use a bit more ability to tension on tires.
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty easy to install, but you're at the mercy of their design / manufacturing tolerances. One chain is slightly looser than the other, and you really can't tighten these beyond what the elastic band does in that case, without some extra hardware of your own. So one of my wheels will loosely slap the pavement (and my wheel well) even at very low speeds. But that seems to be the case with many chain sets, particularly at this price point - so all in all, not a terrible problem. They do seem to help in those situations where you really need them.
customer_reviews.author: JLJ

customer_reviews.title: Sizing chart is not to be trusted
customer_reviews.text: The sizing chart is inaccurate or mis-leading may I provide even further proof. my tire is Bridgestone 225/55R18 WS80 98H BL sizing chart says order SZ139 for a 225/55-18 tire BUT the only sizes listed on the product case ( which you can only see if you get a set of SZ139's) are 215/55-18 215/60-17 215/65-17 215/70-16 225/50-18 225/55/17 255/60-17 and 235/45-18. The two sets I ordered in 2017, which I only needed NOW will not fit the tire. too small! I am screwed and it is snowing here in Victoria BC. And the current sizing chart has the same wrong info!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: rosswind

customer_reviews.title: Nice Set
customer_reviews.text: I needed a set for our new Subaru. I wanted to get them so I would have them in the car. When we go over Donner Pass in the fall - spring, you never know when they will have chain control on. So I would rather have the right thing on hand than have to pay 5 times the price for something that is less quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Z

customer_reviews.title: Great, Easy install & very thin! I had to have that based on my Rig not recommending based on wheel size & factory clearences.
customer_reviews.text: I put them on just test size fit! My Vehicle doesn't recommend traction devices becasue close tolerance. But talk with mechanic he said these would work fine! So I put them went for drive on dry payvment & doing turns & driving at about 20 mile short distance they didn't make any contact with any fixed parts on my rig. Easy to install about 5 minutes on ea side, Now removeing them took alittle longer & had to back rig off of the cable! But still very easy. I'm sure in the snow & ice these will be great. Don't preceive based on where I live I will use them but got them just incase!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey D. Vahala

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I applied them twice before we had to be out in the snow. So knew pretty well how it worked. Watched all videos possible about these chains as well. When i actually installed it in snow and reversed my car... wait attempted to reverse, it snapped. Damaged my car as well. Removing them took 1.5 hours because it snapped and got stuck in the wheel as well. Mind it it was snowing pretty heavy and it not only was a waste, costed a lot of money, time, effort, Frost bite in trying to remove them and the money to uber and get new ones. Which btw worked like a charm. These are the worst chains out there.
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: Installation hell / poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Only half the eyelet fasteners on my set actually engage and fully lock into position. The other half get stuck midway. Not only was I unable to connect all six fasteners on the road, I couldn't even accomplish it in the comfort of my living room. I followed the instructions closely and am no stranger to hardware/tools. Returning these for a different product.
customer_reviews.author: sean

customer_reviews.title: Good cables
customer_reviews.text: Have not used them in snow yet, but have put them on wow very easy to install and they are low profile and slim on my 2006 saturn vue, and nowhere near rubbing anything on the front tires. I ordered extra set for the back tires, and upon a dry run in the yard they did SLIGHTLY rub the parking brake line, but im still glad i ordered the extra pair anyway as spares, and if its life or death will run them on the rear tires anyway after what little damage they will do to the parking brake line, which hardly ever gets used anyway. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: dave rea

customer_reviews.title: a little pricey but they work
customer_reviews.text: easier to put on than the cheap $29 chain sets. easy to take off but be very careful not to move the car during the process lest you wrap them around the axle. do not undo the outside buckle and move the car! undo the outside and inside buckles, then move the car. its best to move car forward until you can easily access the inside buckle from the front. so, undo each chain separately. don't try to undo both at once because its unlikely you'll have both inside buckles aligned. i did notice some rusting after just two days use. if they were $20 less and not rust i'd give 'em 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: carlos castenada

customer_reviews.title: Great for Toyota Prius - easy install/uninstall
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a pair of SZ129 Super Z6 Cable Chains for my wife's Toyota Prius, and they are AWESOME - there is VERY little clearance between the front tires and the fenders, and these cables slip right in. I have a little problem with the cables hanging-up on the struts when removing them, but the problem is more one of "learning how to install/uninstall" than a problem with the cables themselves.
customer_reviews.author: James W. Allison

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: 2011 Hyundai Santa Fe limited. Easy to install. Practice it once before your trip and you are good. I used it for a ski trip, traction was great. Make sure to bring waterproof winter gloves because you'll probably be installing it in wet snow.
customer_reviews.author: M.T.

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to install, great company
customer_reviews.text: I really like these. They’re extremely easy to install and come in a nice case. I haven’t used them in snow yet, but I’d imagine they’d be as functional as any tire chains are. Ease of use it’s a huge plus for me. Edit: I used them in the huge snowstorm in Tahoe a couple weeks ago and they were easy to install. I recommend following the directions on these reviews, and practicing putting them on before you need them so it’s easier when your hands are freezing. I had an issue and needed help from peerless company, and they were quick to respond and had excellent customer service. I highly reccomend these and this company.
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Good chains - No complaints
customer_reviews.text: I used these chain for one weekend this winter. I put them on at my house to test fit and to ensure I learned how to do this prior to installing in the snow. They were snug and secure. The metal wire rope fasteners held the entire length of use, appx 25 miles of snow driving. The travel bag that came with the chains works well and it is not too difficult to get the chains back into the bag after use.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Become a tire chain installation professional!
customer_reviews.text: If you like putting on chains repeatedly, you will love these because any time your tires spin you will throw one. You will become a tire chain installation professional in no time because you will have to repeatedly install one chain after another.
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie Hartley

customer_reviews.title: Very good and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This chains work amazing!!!! I used them for 2 weeks while I was in the mountains in Winter and when it says they are required they really are. These are very easy to install, to remove and they work great!!!! I wasn't sure how easy they were gonna be and got surprised on how easy it is! Totally recommend them if you are a first timer as I was :) The video is in Spanish but you can check how easy it is to install!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 2016 MK7 VW GTI S DSG
customer_reviews.text: Used these twice for a 2016 MK7 VW GTI S DSG. The fit was perfect. Happy that I didn't need to spend an absurd amount of money for the alternative recommendation for my vehicle. No rust at all, just make sure to spray with WD-40 after use and store back into the carrying case it came with. Takes about 10 minutes to install in the snow, very easy!

customer_reviews.title: Worked great.  Only used once but felt good having them with me all season in case needed.
customer_reviews.text: These worked great. Only used them once in freezing rain when I had to go pick up the kids at day care. City streets in Minnesota. I installed them while the truck was in my garage and it was pretty easy. They worked great! Up and down some steep hills on ice. Like I said, I only used them once all winter but I carried them in my truck the whole season so the piece of mind was worth it. I've got a new truck now and different size tires so I'm buying another set.
customer_reviews.author: MagOireachtaigh

customer_reviews.title: These cables give great traction in snow and ice
customer_reviews.text: I live in the San Bernardino mountains and we've had some nasty snow storms this winter, so I needed these to work for me. These cables give great traction in snow and ice, however, 2 crossmembers on the left tire broke in the first week of having them. A week later, a crossmember broke on the right tire. Had to go buy another set locally for reasons of safety.
customer_reviews.author: Francesca Vanderbilt

customer_reviews.title: Size Confusion
customer_reviews.text: These chains are great. The problem I had was finding the correct size for a 2014 Forester with 225/60R17 tires. The sizing chart told me to order SZ143, but when I got them the label on the chain case did not include that tire size. When I checked the Super Z6 chains for my 2010 Forester with slightly different 225/55R17 tires, I discovered the SZ139 chains had both tire sizes listed. I am in the process of contacting the manufacturer to find out what the real story on this is. Shouldn't be this confusing.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Fix perfect to my tire via the chart.
customer_reviews.text: I use them on my 2000 2WD tacoma in combo with 4x 50lb sand bags in the bed. I get around ice and snow no problem in Virginia. I have had for a full winter. They are super light and fairly easy to assemble. Much better than chains. They do rust when stored but the rust rubs off when you use them again. Haven't seen any wear that would be concern. Will re-review if they ever break. I had to use them about 5 times this year all over a 20 mile total commute. Best to run on them at 25 or slower speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Jake3392

customer_reviews.title: Saved our butts
customer_reviews.text: Google maps took us up a road that became to narrow to turn around with a drop off on one side and a rock face on the other. Could not turn around or back down due to snow and ice. These chains saved our butts. Super easy to install and remove. Worked like charm getting us safely back down. Absolutely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Easiest Chains I've ever installed.
customer_reviews.text: I can't comment on the performance yet, but just received these and tried them on the car. They are the easiest chains I've ever installed, and I've installed many chains. Watch the You Tube video for the installation; the key is the silver; single connector goes to the back top; black connector front top, and finally the gold connector front bottom. Then you put on the tighteners. I wish the bag was a little larger; its a tight fit. I'd give a 4.5 if I could because of the bag.
customer_reviews.author: B&B

customer_reviews.title: Solid product, well made and they work!
customer_reviews.text: Best (good traction) and easiest (on and off) cables for the rare occasion my Subaru Crosstrek XV can't navigate the snow and/or ice. Only had used them twice in 3 years! also good for road stops where they check to see if you're carrying chains.
customer_reviews.author: Pugstar

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and remove and good quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for the winter time and chain control, but still never had a chance to actually use it. However, I did try to install to my vehicle to see if it fit well and how quick I can install. Surprisedly it is quite easy to install on front wheels. It also provides rubber bands to fasten the tire chain and adjust its position when the tires are rolling, therefore I don't need to drive a short distance and get out my car to make any adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Fits 2017 Honda CRV
customer_reviews.text: These appear to be high quality chains. I installed them and did a short test ride and they cleared the wheel well. They installed fairly easily and I think the tensioners are a big plus. I was worried about scratching my aluminum wheels but after installation I don’t think that will be a problem. My only complaint is that I inquired of the company about my concern and they never got back to me.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Kistler

customer_reviews.title: Test size immediately upon receipt, their size chart is wrong.
customer_reviews.text: I looked up my tire size (245/75 R16) on the chart and ordered SZ435 and threw them in the truck until last weekend. I found that size is wrong and the attaching cable is about 1.5 inches too short to attach these. One of the rear brackets also appears to be either bent or not stamped right so it will not latch properly. The seller is not willing to help because I did not try them soon enough.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't try the chains before I needed to use them. After watching a YouTube instruction film on the spot, the first chain took less than 10 minutes. The second one took around 5 minutes. Very fast! Removing them is a little bit harder to do because you need to drive the car over the chains to pick them up. I would recommend having a spare pair of gloves and a jacket to carry with the chains. You need to grab the chains under the car and the sleeves of the jacket can get dirty.
customer_reviews.author: patrick_pdx

customer_reviews.title: Good chains worked for me in a snowstorm
customer_reviews.text: Got stuck in a snow storm even though I had snow tires. Very glad I bought these chains. A bunch of other cars could not pass; four wheel drive/all wheel drive cars were stuck too. With these snow chains I was able to make it up the mountain pass in my front wheel drive car. Make sure to clean and lube them after use so they don't rust. Happy with these snow chains.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Better than regular chains.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a car that used to use chains. The chains are great in snow and thick ice but if your in a situation where it's melting (but not all the way gone) or on roads that are being plowed, the cables are vastly preferable. The chains experienced broken links after little use on blacktop, but these cables have been going strong through everything I've put them through. Let's face it, it's often the rural roads where chains are needed while the main roads in town are fine. No one takes off their chains halfway to work, so when you have no choice but to drive on blacktop, these cables are the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: T-Square

customer_reviews.title: Volvo XC 90 T5
customer_reviews.text: Had to break these out on the latest trip to Mammoth. Once we got them on they worked great around town in the 2 + feet of snow that had fallen in town. The SZ429 size (from the chart) was just big enough for the 19" wheels, and therefore took some tugging and pulling to get them on. Fortunately we were not by the side of the road but in the driveway to the condo. However they did work as advertised, and cleared the VERY limited space between the inside of the tire and the strut. The T5 is just front wheel drive (not AWD), but these babies gave us all the traction we needed.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy A. Ballard

customer_reviews.title: These are a lot less "low profile" than you need on a compact car and are a bear to put on.
customer_reviews.text: I can't really use these on my car, comfortably even though they're "cable" chains as they're actually pretty huge and still cause clearance problems. . The clips are also ridiculously hard to engage. I regret purchasing these. Get studded snow tires instead, and put them on cheap steel rims. Keep them in the garage and use them when the season is right.
customer_reviews.author: Andy B

customer_reviews.title: Best cables I've had
customer_reviews.text: These are the best cables I have had for a vehicle. These things are so easy to put on and take off I thought I was putting them on wrong. This is not a normal occurrence for me to so easily deal with traction systems like these. The engineer who put this stuff together really thought about the consumer when he put the time into it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Albright

customer_reviews.title: Worth it not to pay to install
customer_reviews.text: This past weekend I was stuck in a large storm which hit the Sierra Nevadas. We had to put chains on before the Nevada border (we were heading to Sacramento). These were the easiest chains to put on! I was parked next to a guy who had the conventional chains. He was telling his wife to move the car back and forth. The design of these cables allowed me to place them on without moving the car. Needless to say, he started before me, and I finished and left before he was done. Awesome! I had to drive over 50 miles with these cables, and they held the tension wonderfully. It was just as easy to take off. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Steadie Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Important function won't work
customer_reviews.text: This would be a good product IF THE CONNECTORS would connect! I installed BOTH chains, and each one had a connector that would NOT connect no matter how I tried!! Very frustrating. Purchased these chains because they were supposed to be the easiest for a woman to install. Everything worked as the video showed, except the simple connectors did not connect. It should have been very SIMPLE...
customer_reviews.author: Susie Jones

customer_reviews.title: Possibly great, but not for my 2017 Audi Q7.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these months before I tried them out before a ski trip, and they didn't fit my Audi Q7. THIS REVIEW IS NOT A DIG AGAINST THE PRODUCT ITSELF, just the realization that my SUV can't accommodate this type of cable chain: there is more than enough clearance between the tires and the wheel well, but there's no clearance between the inside of the tire and the suspension components. I'll have to get something like Spikes-Spiders (that don't have any cable components on the inside of the tire/wheel when in operation.) But we're talking over $600 for those. Yikes!
customer_reviews.author: LeoG49

customer_reviews.title: Space saver carry bag for superb zchains
customer_reviews.text: Just tip on carrying these cables. I've got two sets for my 4x4. The plastic cases are big and waste space. I bought a (NiceClimbs Rock Climbing Rope Bag) and the four cable chains fit well and take up about 1/4 the space. The bag has compression straps to reduce size. The bag also has a built in drop cloth that helps when mounting in sloppy conditions.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Works for BMW F30 RWD 225/50 R17
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied with the product: 1. Easy to put and remove 2. They do provide plenty of traction We used them on a RWD in snow, 225/50 R17. Tip : Use them only if you actually do need the additional traction (there is a decent amount of snow and/or the wheels slip). If you put the chain and there is not enough snow the car will be shaking a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Alex and Funtik

customer_reviews.title: DON’T TRUST AMAZON SIZE GUIDE
customer_reviews.text: SZ143 does not fit 17” alloy wheels on 2018 Toyota Camry LE. Fits the 18” wheels XLE and XSE. Had to zip-tie the rubber tensioner as tight as possible to keep them from falling off. Thank god I had zip ties in the car. Don’t trust the Amazon size guide. Assume it is wrong and double check other size guides. Got stuck in -15F with frozen fingers trying to figure out what I was doing wrong before I realized it was too big. 2 stars bc after I got the zip ties to tighten the chains, it worked great until the zip ties froze and broke every 2 miles.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy.
customer_reviews.text: These are quick and easy to install and remove. They’re also smoother to drive on than link chains. Good price, and they come in a nice bag. Probably not best for heavy duty use, but perfect for the few times a year that chains are needed in So-Cal, or to keep in the back of our all-wheel drive that will rarely need them.
customer_reviews.author: Gary L.

customer_reviews.title: A very easy to put on and take off, useless product
customer_reviews.text: These are mildly OK at helping move while in snow on a flat surface...unless that flat surface is asphalt...then all these do is spin. No grip whatsoever. Forget about trying to go uphill in snow and ice that is scattered with clear asphalt spots. I had to take them off and turn around. These are utterly useless.
customer_reviews.author: Bond

customer_reviews.title: I would give .5 star if I could.
customer_reviews.text: It is a product, that is it. This failed after driving 5 feet. Went from one stall to install, broke after 5 feet, went to next stall to remove. Not safe, if I was on highway my family and I would be dead meat!! Buyer beware, this is more dangerous than the snow itself....
customer_reviews.author: Butch

customer_reviews.title: Easy on
customer_reviews.text: I've only utilized these when parking on an incline and realizing my truck was sliding down it in Park. I slapped these on in anticipation to have to back out, but the car in front of me moved by that time. They did prevent my truck from sliding more. Once you read the instructions on installation, they go on pretty quick. The snaps close quickly and the tensioner pulls everything tight and is easy to attach.
customer_reviews.author: FilmComposer

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install and remove, great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: I don't typically write Amazon reviews but this product deserves an exception. The chains took less than 5 minutes total to install on both wheels of my Jeep Renegade and it worked great. Drove for around an hour on them on the way back from Lake Tahoe and was very satisfied. It's practical, works as intended, and very affordable, too. One thing is, when it mentions "gloves are included" the glows are just a nylon bag shaped like a hand. Those immediately got destroyed and your fingers still hurt through them. Thankfully I had some mechanic gloves in my car, you should probably get some too.
customer_reviews.author: cgokmen

customer_reviews.title: Great chains for high-performance, street vehicles but not for everyday use.
customer_reviews.text: Really good product. Purchased for my 2003 X5 with 18" wheels - works like a dream for those few days where it snows in Portland. The grip is good not great and I have experienced wheel spin from time to time. Perhaps getting another set for the rear might be a good idea. Avoid dry/snowless roads at all costs - they just don't do well on dry patches and you can't drive over 20-25MPH. Install was fast and relatively painless.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky

customer_reviews.title: High reviews, low performance
customer_reviews.text: I bought these chains due to their high ratings and decent price, but I've been left with a poor taste in my mouth. The chains were simple to install and fit perfectly on my tires, which is definitely a plus. On flat ground with half an inch of snow, they worked okay. But when I got home, I could not make it up my driveway! I ended up taking these chains off and got better traction with just my all season tires.
customer_reviews.author: Dallin DeFord

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product. Fit perfectly on 215/55/R17. Snubbers provide a snug fit to the tires.
customer_reviews.text: These fit my 2010 Chevy Malibu LT with 215/55R17 tires. The quality is very good and the snubbers pull them snug against the tires. Easier to install if you lay them out flat and place an 8" long 2x4 across the tread path, in the opening between the cross treads, about 8-10" back of the latch. Then drive the car onto the 2x4 and fasten them. Repeat for the other wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Warren

customer_reviews.title: but in terms of fit they fit great while clearing everything inside of the wheel well
customer_reviews.text: My 2017 WRX has a very tight clearance in the wheel well so I searched to find the lowest profile tire chain out there and this is it. I never had to actually use them so I can't comment on their function or durability, but in terms of fit they fit great while clearing everything inside of the wheel well. I bought these to use as more of insurance, hoping to never need it, but having it there in case I do.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher N.

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste you money
customer_reviews.text: Impossible to install and did not seem to fit tire at all - finally gave up. I should have known when the vendor recommends practicing on dry roadway. Kinda defeats the purpose. Also, seems they vendor does not accept returns - so I wouldn't give these a passing thought.
customer_reviews.author: Craig D. Galler

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use in all conditions!
customer_reviews.text: Saved my life. No, but seriously. Ice storm = bad driving conditions and there were 4 of us and a dog about 80 miles from home and work/plane flight the next day. EASY to put on - took me maybe 15 minutes in the DARK for the FIRST TIME USING THEM. Having had to use many kinds of chains before (I love going to the snow), I like these for ease of use, good price point, and carrying bag. FYI, I like to throw some gardening gloves with the rubberized palms and a cheap flashlight in with the bag.
customer_reviews.author: PDXLee

customer_reviews.title: Worked well on my Toyota 4Runner
customer_reviews.text: Drove up north to Mammoth from the Los Angeles area. Snow chains were required as we got into Mammoth. Slapped the snow chains on the rear tires of my Toyota 4Runner. I had no issues at all controlling the car. Be sure to practice putting on and taking off the snow chains before you actually have to use them.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M.

customer_reviews.title: Work as well as any chains I've used
customer_reviews.text: Only used them once, so far; was plowing through snow up to the door in my little car with no problem. Make sure to measure your tire before you buy, I guestimated and got lucky, but they still fit a little loose, have to twist up the tension ring a bunch.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: these snow chain/cables are easy to install and work!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 4x4 Jeep and still we were required to have chains on around Mammoth/ June lake area. Even in the wind and snow they were not bad to put on. I practiced first in my drive way. I didn't need them for very long or very far- only about 8 miles- but they stayed put and probably made driving in some really bad weather safer.
customer_reviews.author: rkanatzar

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use ... helps traction as designed.
customer_reviews.text: The fit was spot on. But you need to check the exact tire size and look at the fit table by the manufacturer. Was relatively easy to put on and take off ... get ready to get somewhat dirty though ... knees, hands and forearms. Also, get some cheap gloves. The plastic gloves in the bag will not do much. Lastly, you’ll need a stick with a hook or one of those windshield scrapers to help swing the chains around tires.
customer_reviews.author: Ari

customer_reviews.title: Not worth a penny
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item based on the reviews and I’m deeply disappointed there’s not only doesn’t work in the snow it doesn’t work. They tore my tires up my car couldn’t move in the snow little bit disgusting item don’t buy this not even review say 1000 cars got out of the snow you should still not buy it. It’s a waste of money and a waste of time
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't fit - no support
customer_reviews.text: Bought a set of these in the size specified for my tires. They don't fit, by several inches. Manufacturer (Peerless) agrees. Amazon won't take them back. So, now I am stuck with a useless set of chains. Too bad I cannot give them zero stars.
customer_reviews.author: Evan S

customer_reviews.title: Good Chains when it works
customer_reviews.text: I had these chains on my prior cars and loved it. However, on my KiA 2017 minivan, i installed ot and drove for about 2 miles when i noticed the handling changed. I pulled over to the side of the road, amd noticed one wheel had no chains anymore! It just fell off. On the other wheel i noticed it was too loose, which would explain why the other feel off. Keep in mind, if you have low clearance in the bottom of your car, like a mini van, it will be difficult to take off.
customer_reviews.author: I. Koenig

customer_reviews.title: Did not fit my tires of size 215/65R17
customer_reviews.text: Despite the manufacturer catalog stating that these chains should fit my tires of size 215/65R17, they did not fit. I am glad that I figured that out when I tried putting them on in my garage and not in the middle of a snowstorm. Also, I first spent an hour trying to figure out how to put them by reading the instructions included. That was a mistake - the instructions are quite badly written and very difficult to follow. I was able to put them on after watching the instructional video .... too bad they did not fit.
customer_reviews.author: A S

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for 08 Honda CRV
customer_reviews.text: The chains didn’t work on my wife’s 08 Honda CRV. They did fit the 225/65-17 tire, but made contact with part of the shock assembly. Unfortunately I had to return them, but they looked well built. The install and removal was easy on my driveway test fit. I would recommend them, but make sure they work for your application.
customer_reviews.author: Mando

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit. Twice. Give up
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't fit according to their size chart. These are my second pair I purchased and it still doesn't fit. The first pair was because Amazon said it would fit my Lexus IS250 (which was wrong). The second time was after I double checked my tire size and got the right size it still doesn't fit. I can't latch the back end at all
customer_reviews.author: robert

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last
customer_reviews.text: Broke after 3 uses in the snow. Going back to old fashioned chains.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: These work extremely well, are easy to set up, and are durable.
customer_reviews.text: These work extremely well, are easy to set up, and are durable. These are a life saver and very reliable. i drive a front wheel drive car in Alaska, and have a single set of these are a great idea, but having 2 sets is even better.
customer_reviews.author: BrickyardDrifter

customer_reviews.title: Chain clasp didn't stay closed
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used these in snow, one came off while I was driving. I had difficulty getting the clasp on the back side of that chain to stay closed when I was putting it on. Following the directions, I joined male and female ends at a right angle and then twisted to straighten the cable and hold the clasp together. The two ends kept coming apart, even with the tensioner in place. I thought I finally got the clasp to close and drove about a hundred yards to see if it held. It seemed to, but once I reached the chain off area, the chain was gone. I am disappointed with the poor quality of the clasp.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Gloves Included!?!? Not the reason I bought the set, but still.... 🤣🤣🤣
customer_reviews.text: Look like they will do the job. Easier to install than my last pair. Not sure what the gloves are supposed to do for you... maybe to keep brake dust off while Testing them out at home in the garage? Thanks, I needed that laugh! If I don’t update, then they worked as expected.
customer_reviews.author: SmBizOwner

customer_reviews.title: Worked with a Prius
customer_reviews.text: Ended up using on an icy road heading up the mountain, once tires started slipping. Installed easier than expected on a Prius, as well as removing later. Great traction the rest of the way. Slow speed, but secure on the road.
customer_reviews.author: LDB

customer_reviews.title: Honestly a life saver
customer_reviews.text: 2018 Hyundai Elantra. They were a little rough to get off and on but I've also never used any chains before. Putting them on took around 6 minutes and taking them off took half that. I wished I had the tool to grab the chains around the backside of the tire. That tool also would have helped me knock ice off to give more room for installing. I used them on I70 outside of denver colorado. They are the only reason I made it past hundreds of stranded vehicles into denver. For under $100 these aren't bad at all. I let them dry afterwards so no rust.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Coulson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put on and take off--even for this 60-year-old ...
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly--just in time for a trip to Tahoe. Easy to put on and take off--even for this 60-year-old female, though I highly recommend bringing a pair of pliers to help knock the metal clasps into place, and a flashlight in the bag for nighttime applications, which we forgot! They had a great fit, especially with the extra rubber and clasp tighteners I bought to go with them,and they worked so well in the ice and snow that we used them the following week for a trip to the Giant Sequoias in the Sierra Nevada Mountains and a fun day at Wolverton Snow park for the grand kids.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Wood

customer_reviews.title: Good for low clearance cars like my Jetta.
customer_reviews.text: So much easier than old school cables. For cars like my Jetta that gave very little clearance these are a dream. Still think real chain is better but since there isn’t enough clearance for real chains these do just find. Good for snow. A bit sketchy on ice.
customer_reviews.author: cyndi c. coleman

customer_reviews.title: These chains got us through some great icy and snowy conditions and two amazing skiing
customer_reviews.text: I used these in the mountain snow with my minivan. I am very used to driving in snow, but deep mountain snow storms was a different story. These chains got us through some great icy and snowy conditions and two amazing skiing. They were very easy to install, and held up incredibly well. Mountain storms are definitely different than Wisconsin, so I'm very glad I have these with me.
customer_reviews.author: Active Engineer

customer_reviews.title: They DO NOT  FIT P235/60R17 tires
customer_reviews.text: They don't fit my tires. I have a 2019Toyota Sienna - Front wheel drive. Unfortunately, I waited more than 30 days before trying them so I can't return them.
customer_reviews.author: NATHAN

customer_reviews.title: Best cable chain design
customer_reviews.text: Fit great. My 17 year old son was able to put these on in under 5 minutes just from looking at the pictures in the instructions. The duel split design allowing you to put them on without reaching under the car in bad weather it a huge plus. Only used once so far and even though I prefer real chains (that wont fit most cars) these cables did better than I had expected.
customer_reviews.author: Stumpydad

customer_reviews.title: Good for low clearance!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put on!! 2013 Acadia Denali has very low clearance between shock mount and tire. These fit nice on P255/55R20. I had trouble getting up a steep driveway with some ice, I'm sure chains perform better. But these are great to drive on and get through inspection point.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Hard work but worth it
customer_reviews.text: You gave to pull crazy hard to get the last latch to hook on. But after I figured that out it was a breeze. I like that you can put them on without having to move the car. I drive a smart car and had to move it for a winter storm. Once it was stuck there was no way I could have put on conventional chains because the car wouldn’t budge. With these on the back tires I had zero trouble driving in slick 5” snow.
customer_reviews.author: WarriorWhite

customer_reviews.title: Great traction, feels a little like driving a tank
customer_reviews.text: Excellent traction, easy to install, and the chatter while driving on bare ice areas has the added bonus of allowing me to pretend I was driving a tank. I was able to get these onto my car in about 2 minutes after a fairly embarrassing five minute climb up the 100 yard hill down the street from my house. They've been used many times since, with nary a problem to report.
customer_reviews.author: Bilbo Fredericks

customer_reviews.title: Always be prepared, these might save you a huge tow bill.
customer_reviews.text: They look like they would work well, however they can't be installed once you are stuck in the mud or snow. So with that caveat, if you think you are going to be stuck put them on. They will probably work well. They look to be of quality construction and had I installed them before I got stuck they would not be too difficult to install. They do recommend installing them as practice.
customer_reviews.author: L. Galiano

customer_reviews.title: I like the tension bands these come with
customer_reviews.text: Used SZ143 for our 2014 Sienna. Also brought the SZ137 for my 2014 Volt. Both fit well and they are well made. I like the tension bands these come with, it really keeps it snug on the tire. I had read someone else's review saying the SZ137 rubs the shock on the Volt, but that wasn't my experience. I made sure it was very snug on the outside and didn't have any problems when I test drove it with the chain on.
customer_reviews.author: R. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Great for temporary use in the worst of weather.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these and put them in the trunk in case of bad ice/snow. I live in Nashville, TN so when we do get winter weather it shuts the city down. Working in a hospital I can't just call in due to weather, but we also don't get enough snow here annually to warrant genuine winter tires either. I've used them several days now on my commute and they are great. Sure I'm limited to 30mph but I can go anywhere I point the car on ice/slush/snow/whatever. They have now paid for themselves several times over. I added a pic to show how they clawed into my frozen driveway when turning around.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Rumbaugh

customer_reviews.title: Fit perfect on my Lexus RX 350
customer_reviews.text: It is very easy to put on. I practice putting them on and it only takes about 10 min for each tire. My tires are factory size and not a custom size.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Huynh

customer_reviews.title: Bought for Tahoe Trip
customer_reviews.text: Got for husband’s 2005 Subaru WRX front wheels. He had no problem installing it. Removing it though, one of the hooks caught up in the back. Husband had to take out the car jack to boot it up and find the culprit.
customer_reviews.author: ShopperLife

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy chains.
customer_reviews.text: Had to use it during our drive to Big Bear. Came in very handy, easy to put on if you follow the directions. I recommend taking extra gloves. These come with plastic gloves. Very durable and moderate price. My sister got the exact one after seeing mine.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Lots of advantages, just not for heavy-duty use. Very easy to put on in adverse conditions, a big plus.
customer_reviews.text: All the Z chains and I have had several for different vehicles are good chains, but they are easily torn up under off-road conditions where I have used them exclusively. Once variety of these were the only chains I get to fit on a large camper. (Yes, in bad conditions put chains on everything). They can be thrown by a large pick-up so I would not put them there. (This refers to the heavier variety). But they will get you out of the ditch where conventional chains are very difficult to get on. But I think Z chains in general are best for lighter duty use.
customer_reviews.author: Loyd

customer_reviews.title: Thought They Would Be Pretty Good
customer_reviews.text: Hooked up both chains at the chaining area, got a quarter mile down the road and the connector just got pulled apart. Had to hike back up the highway in a blizzard to buy another set of chains. These aren't the most robust chains either. I thought they'd be light and handy. Honestly it's easier to connect a set of traditional chains in the snow. You have to toss these behind the tires and fish them out. Then you need to make all the connections. I put on traditional dive-over chains on faster with less fuss.
customer_reviews.author: Vic

customer_reviews.title: Great chains, easy to install!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a trip to Colorado over the holidays. I ended up not needing them on the trip but the piece of mind knowing I had them along just in case was nice. I did a test install at home before our trip and was able to put both chains on in less than 5 minutes. Taking them off was nearly as easy, just had to unhook and then backup a little bit so the tire wasn't on it. They come in a nice, compact blue bag - roughly 5"x5"x20" or so that tucks away in a corner of the trunk/cargo area and garage when not needed.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M. Mcdonnell

customer_reviews.title: SZ477 for Suburban Z71
customer_reviews.text: These traction devices were purchased for a 2012 Chevy 1500 Suburban Z71 w/ 18" wheels. Although Chevy Owners Manual says chains will not fit on this vehicle, the SCC SZ477 traction devices cleared easily on the rear wheels and with about 1/2" to spare on the front through the full turning arc. Very easy to install. Mounted the SZ477 on all four wheels in about the time it took to mount conventional chains on two wheels, plus only having to get out and on my back once in the slush. They stow neatly out of the way and meet California DOT traction device requirements, which are very restrictive. I'd recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: GJ Colorado -

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality if they fit.
customer_reviews.text: I've used chains my whole life but they did not fit 2001 Camry with standard tires as Amazon said,very unhappy. Almost got stranded because of it. They seemed like they would be good if they fit properly.
customer_reviews.author: CF

customer_reviews.title: Chains broke while driving on snow & ice.
customer_reviews.text: Chains broke while driving on snow & ice, left the whole family at risk while driving downhill from Tahoe City to Sacramento. The chains have been installed according to instructions on our 2013 Volkswagen Passat, but they are not well designed for this car. They were touching the plastic inside the wing from the first miles. After about 30 miles driven at 25 mph one broke completely and the other one got loose. Pretty scary as we were driving on snow with patches of ice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Security Chain Company SZ143 Super Z6 Cable Tire Chain for Passenger Cars, Pickups, and SUVs - Set of 2
product_meta.description:
Size:SZ143For more than a decade Z-Chain has been the winter traction product choice for police, fire, ambulance and other professional fleets throughout North America. Z-Chain’s fast installation, aggressive traction performance and extreme durability simply out-class all other options.

AMAZON.COM
The SCC Super Z6 SZ143 winter traction product offers superior performance for cars, pickups, and SUVs with very limited operating clearance around the drive tires. Be ready for winter driving with an innovative solution that is a step beyond traditional tire chains.

 New Design
Based on the "Z" family of products, the Super Z6 is designed for vehicles with restricted clearance around the drive tires. The Super Z6 requires only 6.33 millimeters (.25 inches) of sidewall clearance to operate, less than half the space required by most cable and tire chains. 

A diagonal crossmember pattern provides better outstanding traction and durability than conventional chain systems. Easy to Install
A split outside cable with two fastening positions allows for easy installation without moving the vehicle, so there's no need to stop and retighten. The traction coils are manufactured from alloy steel to increase the lifespan of the product. The Super Z6 is also designed to prevent scratching of alloy or high performance tire rims.

 Versatility
The Super Z6 is available to fit passenger cars, pickups, and SUV tire sizes. It offers a unique combination of performance and convenience features for every user, including a "designed-in" rubber tightener, better all-around traction performance than conventional tire chains or cables, and greater durability.

 Designed for High Performance
The Super Z6 has better compatibility with anti-lock brakes, traction control, all-wheel drive, and other electronically monitored control systems so as not to interfere with the normal handling characteristics of your vehicle. The unique design also offers a low potential for damage to vehicle body and mechanical components, even when abused.

 The Super Z6 SZ143 is designed for tires sized from approximately 215 to 285 millimeters. Check the manufacturer's website for the exact product to fit your tire size. Also check your owner's manual for clearance specifications before installing winter traction products.

 What's in the Box
Chains, plastic gloves, one pair of rubber tensioners, durable, re-usable nylon bag, and clear, illustrated step-by-step installation and removal instructions.
feature_bullets: Please refer to the Application Guide under Technical Specification or product images and for fitment details, and product video for installation instructions.
Designed for cars, pickups, and SUVs with very limited operating clearance around the drive tires
Fast easy installation with no need to move the vehicle
Designed-in rubber tightener means there is no need to stop and retighten after installation
Better all-around traction performance than conventional tire chains or cables
Better compatibility with anti-lock brakes, traction control, all-wheel drive, and other electronically monitored control systems

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,929 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars

specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
